mdRecord.dcterms:description: Belton has been described as a compilation of all that is finest of Carolean architecture, the only truly vernacular style of architecture that England had produced since the Tudor period. The house has also been described as the most complete example of a typical English country house. ... house and contents given to the National Trust 1984, which operates it as an historic house museum. -- https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Belton_House [work]
